description: From wan- +â€Ž chancy. Compare unchancy. More at wan-, chancy.

adjectives.description: wanchancy (comparative more wanchancy, superlative most wanchancy)

examples: It was the day of warlocks and apparitions, now happily driven out by the zeal of the General Assembly. Witches pursued their wanchancy calling, bairns were spirited away, young lassies selled their souls to the Evil One, and the Accuser of the Brethren, in the shape of a black tyke, was seen about cottage doors in the gloaming.
